content.query:
USE nyc_taxi_discovery;

-- Select data from the folder
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=2020/month=01/green_tripdata_2020-01.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]

--Select all the files from the folder

SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=2020/month=01/',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]

--or

SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=2020/month=01/*',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]

--or
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=2020/month=01/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]

--Select all the files from folder year=2020 i.e., select data from subfolder
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=2020/*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]

--Get data of subfolder with '**'
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=2020/**',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]

--Get data from more than one file
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK ('trip_data_green_csv/year=2020/month=01/*.csv',
        'trip_data_green_csv/year=2020/month=02/*.csv'),
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]

--To get data from all the years and all months
SELECT
    TOP 100 *
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]

--If we want to know the source of data, i.e. from which file data comes.
--file metadata function filename()
SELECT
    TOP 100 *,
    result.filename() as file_name,
    result.*
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]

--count of the file per months
SELECT
    result.filename() as file_name,
    count(*) as record_count
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]
group by result.filename()
order by file_name

--limit data using filename()
SELECT
    result.filename() as file_name,
    count(*) as record_count
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]
where result.filename() IN ('green_tripdata_2020-01.csv','green_tripdata_2020-02.csv')
group by result.filename()
order by file_name;

--using filepath function
SELECT
    result.filename() as file_name,
    result.filepath() as file_path,
    count(*) as record_count
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]
where result.filename() IN ('green_tripdata_2020-01.csv','green_tripdata_2020-02.csv')
group by result.filename(), result.filepath()
order by file_name,file_path;

--from filepath() find year, month and filename (trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv)
SELECT
    result.filename() as file_name,
    result.filepath(1) as year,
    result.filepath(2) as month,
    count(*) as record_count
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]
group by result.filename(), result.filepath(1), result.filepath(2)
order by file_name, result.filepath(1), result.filepath(2);

--Use filepath in where clause
SELECT
    result.filepath(1) as year,
    result.filepath(2) as month,
    count(*) as record_count
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'trip_data_green_csv/year=*/month=*/*.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'nyc_taxi_data_raw',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        PARSER_VERSION = '2.0',
        HEADER_ROW = TRUE
    ) AS [result]
where result.filepath(1) = '2020'
and result.filepath(2) in ('07', '08', '09')
group by result.filepath(1), result.filepath(2)
order by result.filepath(1), result.filepath(2);

--Use filename() and filepath() for faster query execution.
